entries: You can cast {@spell compulsion} once without expending a spell slot and without using material components. Once you do so, you can't cast it in this way again until you finish a long rest

spell.name: Flame Blade (Revised)
entries: You evoke a fiery blade in your free hand for the duration. This magic sword lasts until the spell ends, and it counts as a simple melee weapon with which you are proficient. The sword has the approximate size, shape and value of a longsword and it lasts for the duration. The sword deals {@damage 2d6} fire damage on a hit and uses your spellcasting ability for its attack and damage rolls.
If you let go of the blade, it disappears, but you can evoke the blade again as a bonus action until the duration expires.
The flaming blade sheds bright light in a 10-foot radius and dim light for an additional 10 feet.

entriesHigherLevel.name: At Higher Levels
entries: When you cast this spell using a spell slot of 4th level or higher, the damage increases by {@dice 1d6} for every two slot levels above 2nd.

spell.name: Immolation (Revised)
entries: Flames wreathe one creature you can see within range. The target must make a Dexterity saving throw. The target takes {@damage 10d6} fire damage on a failed save or half as much on a successful one. On a failed save, the target also burns for the spell's duration. The burning target sheds bright light in a 30-foot radius and dim light for an additional 30 feet.

Until the spell ends, you can use a bonus action on each subsequent turn to force the target to repeat the saving throw. It takes {@damage 4d6} fire damage on a failed save, or half as much on a successful one. These flames can't be extinguished by nonmagical means.
If damage from this spell kills a creature, the creature is turned to ash.

spell.name: Big Boss Hoss G's Brown Note
entries: You play a musical note that causes unpleasant bowel movements to its listeners. All other creatures within 30 feet of you must make a Constitution saving throw. On a failure, a creature takes {@damage 3d6} poison damage, becomes {@condition poisoned} until the end of their next turn, and shits their pants. On a successful save, a creature takes half as much damage, does not become {@condition poisoned}, and doesn't shit their pants.
A {@condition deafened} creature automatically succeeds on their saving throw, and a creature is immune to this spell if if its anatomy does not feature a digestive system.

m.text: a musical instrument worth at least 1 sp

entriesHigherLevel.name: At Higher Levels
entries: When you cast this spell using a spell slot of 2nd level or higher, the damage increases by {@dice 1d6} for each slot level above 1st.

spell.name: Ironhide's Lightning Swallow

components.m: a bit of fur and a piece of amber, crystal, or glass

entries: You gather an intense concentration of lightning onto your hand. As part of the spell, you can use any remaining movement this turn to charge at a creature in a straight line. Additionally, your movement speed is increased by 30 feet until the end of this turn.

Make a melee spell attack against a creature within range. On a hit, the target takes {@damage 2d10} lightning damage. The target also takes an additional {@damage 1d6} piercing damage for every 10 feet that you moved as part of this spell, up to a maximum of {@dice 3d6}.

entriesHigherLevel.name: At Higher Levels
entries: When you cast this spell using a spell slot of 3rd level or higher, the lightning damage increases by {@dice 1d10} for each slot level above 2nd.

spell.name: Ironhide's Undying Marionette

components.m: a length of thread tied in a surgeon's knot

entries: Illusory threads appear from your joints, puppeteering your body to move beyond its physical limits. Until the spell ends, you gain the following benefits:
When you hit a target with a melee weapon attack, that target takes extra damage equal to your spellcasting ability modifier (minimum of 1).
You gain resistance to bludgeoning, piercing, and slashing damage.
You have advantage on Strength and Dexterity saving throws.

You have advantage on all ability checks and saving throws to avoid being {@condition stunned}, {@condition paralyzed}, {@condition restrained}, {@condition grappled}, and moved against your will; and magic can't put you to sleep.

If you drop you to 0 hit points but don't die outright, you can make a DC 10 Saving throw with your spellcasting ability. If you succeed, you drop to 1 hit point instead. Each time that you use this ability after the first, the DC increases by 5, resetting to 10 when the spell ends. When you take damage in this way, you make this saving throw before you make your Constitution saving throw to maintain concentration.

Immediately after the spell ends, you must succeed on a DC 15 Constitution saving throw or suffer one level of {@condition exhaustion}, and your hit point maximum is reduced by 12. This reduction lasts until you finish a long rest. If this effect reduces your hit point maximum to 0, you die.

spell.name: Pressure Cutter
entries: You unleash a razor sharp blast of wind forming a line 60 feet long and 15 feet wide in a direction you choose. Each creature in the area must make a Dexterity saving throw. A creature takes {@damage 10d6} slashing damage on a failed save and half as much on a successful one.

entriesHigherLevel.name: At Higher Levels
entries: When you cast this spell using a spell slot of 6th level or higher, the damage increases by {@dice 1d6} for each slot level above 5th.

spell.name: Single Bone Cremation
entries: You release an intense concentration of heat and explosive power from your hand. Make a melee spell attack against a creature within your reach. On a hit, the target takes {@damage 8d6} fire damage.

If you hit, a destructive blast of concussive force explodes from your blow. All creatures within a 20-foot cube originating from your target must make a Constitution saving throw. On a failed save, a creature takes {@damage 2d10} force damage, and is pushed 10 feet away from you. On a successful save, a creature takes half as much damage and isn't pushed.

entriesHigherLevel.name: At Higher Levels
entries: When you cast this spell using a spell slot of 4th level or higher, the fire damage increases by {@dice 1d6} and the size of the cube increases by 5 feet for every slot level above 3rd.

spell.name: Trajectory Control

components.m: a weapon with the ammunition or thrown property

entries: You release the weapon used in the spell's casting and make a ranged spell attack against a target within 150 feet of you. You can control the trajectory of the weapon's flight, allowing you to ignore half, three-quarters, and full cover as long as you are aware of the target's location.
On a hit, the target takes {@dice 1d8} of the weapon's damage type.

entriesHigherLevel.name: At Higher Levels
entries: The spell's damage increases by {@dice 1d8} when you reach 5th level ({@dice 2d8}), 11th level ({@dice 3d8}), and 17th level ({@dice 4d8}).
